items.name: python
items.short_description: Python is a dynamically typed programming language.
items.description: Python is a dynamically-typed garbage-collected programming language developed by Guido van Rossum in the late 80s to replace ABC. Much like the programming language Ruby, Python was designed to be easily read by programmers. Because of its large following and many libraries, Python can be implemented and used to do anything from webpages to scientific research.

items.name: django
items.short_description: Django is a web application framework for Python.
items.description: Django is a web application framework for Python. It is designed to prioritize principles of reusability and rapid development.

items.name: flask
items.short_description: Flask is a web framework for Python based on the Werkzeug toolkit.
items.description: Flask is a web framework for Python, based on the Werkzeug toolkit.
